title: API Docs: fmt

labels.name: E-mentor
labels.description: Call for participation: This issue has a mentor. Use RustcContributor::new on Zulip for discussion.

labels.name: E-help-wanted
labels.description: Call for participation: Help is requested to fix this issue.

labels.name: E-medium
labels.description: Call for participation: Experience needed to fix: Medium / intermediate

labels.name: A-docs
labels.description: Area: documentation for any part of the project, including the compiler, standard library, and tools

labels.name: C-tracking-issue
labels.description: Category: A tracking issue for an RFC or an unstable feature.

body:
Part of https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/29329

http://doc.rust-lang.org/std/fmt/


Here's what needs to be done to close out this issue: 

- [the module level docs](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/fmt/) almost belong in their own issue. These are very old docs written long ago, and while they're good, I have a hunch they could be made way better. Not needed to close this issue.
- [x] all of [the traits](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/fmt/#traits) should say "`C` formatting", where `C` is the char, rather than their current boilerplate. Except Write. And Display. 
- [x] [`fmt::Result`](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/fmt/type.Result.html) needs an example, showing off the `use std::fmt; fmt::Result` pattern.
- [x] [`write`](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/fmt/fn.write.html) should have its `Arguments` section removed, we don't do this.
- [x] [`format`](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/fmt/fn.format.html) has the same issue, and needs more explanation generally.
- [ ] All of the traits have... I dunno, the wording feels awkward. This doesn't need to be fixed to close this issue, but would be nice.
- [x] [`Write`](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/fmt/trait.Write.html) needs a lot of links. and some examples.
- [x] [`Arguments`](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/fmt/struct.Arguments.html) needs examples, but also a justification of why this is all done this way.
- [x] [`DebugList`](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/fmt/struct.DebugList.html) should use the iterator boilerplate language, even though it's not an iterator. Mostly pointing to the docs of the function that creates it.
- [x] [`DebugMap`](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/fmt/struct.DebugMap.html) same.
- [x] [`DebugSet`](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/fmt/struct.DebugSet.html) same.
- [x] [`DebugStruct`](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/fmt/struct.DebugStruct.html) same.
- [x] [`DebugTuple`](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/fmt/struct.DebugTuple.html) same.
- [x] [`Error`](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/fmt/struct.Error.html) needs examples, and specifically `use std::fmt; fmt::Error`
- [ ] [`Formatter`](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/fmt/struct.Formatter.html) should show where it's created, and talk about the details more.
